instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> gfx problem

threads.title: how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Replace the board with an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board and jimmy rig the LCD cable. Then chuck the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board at the wall violently until it breaks in half.

threads.title: how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"non gfx" you mean no Intel graphics???
Permanently disabling GPU is no problem anymore; just get Tiresias module.

threads.title: how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: send details how to make this

threads.title: how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
First clarify what exactly want to do.
Do you have problems with Intel Graphics, or dedicated (GPU)?

threads.title: how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Question: what is Tiresias module?? Is it same as dying light module from doslabs?  I have bypassed gmux on few machines and i am looking for a way to control brightness

threads.title: how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Tiresias is a "fast mod" to disable GPU.
[url]http://www.cmizapper.com/products/tiresias-gpukiller.html[/url]

Dying light module allows backlight adjust, after GPU was previously disabled...

threads.title: how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
how to make non gfx <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Tiresias mod doesn't need that module.
Backlight adjust will work normally.
And Tiresias can be get for very good price, in quantity...
